title: Billy Crystal almost hit by bike filming dramatic Here Today scenes
text:
Billy almost got mowed down by a delivery bike (Picture: MEGA)

Billy Crystal was seen shooting dramatic scenes for his new movie Here Today, which saw the actor almost get mown down by a delivery man on a bike.

The actor, 71, has been filming scenes with the stuntman in Brooklyn, New York, this week and it looked like he had a pretty close call as the delivery man landed inches away from his feet.

As well as starring in the movie, Billy is also directing and producing Here Today, which sees him play a veteran comedy writer losing his touch on reality who becomes friends with a younger street singer, played by Tiffany Haddish.

The comedy will focus on their touching friendship which defies the generation gap and how that redefined the meaning of love and trust between them.

The story is based on a short story by Alan Zweibel called The Prize, and he teamed up with Billy to create the Here Today screenplay.

Billy clutched his face as he filmed the dramatic scenes (Picture: MEGA)

‘Someone should probably stop that man over there on the bike…’ (Picture: MEGA)

The stunt man was seen sprawled on the floor (Picture: MEGA)

Billy told Variety: ‘I’m so grateful to get the chance to bring this charming and beautiful story to life. To write this with Alan was a joy, and to have Tiffany as my co-star is fantastic.

‘The generational differences in our comedy will be great to play with. She’s explosively funny and genuinely human at the same time. Excited to explore all our possibilities together.’

As well as Billy and Tiffany, the movie will also star Penn Badgley, Louisa Krause, Laura Benanti, Alex Brightman, Anna Deavere Smith and Nyambi Nyambi.

No details about a possible release date have been revealed as of yet.
